intro: Aronia arborea, commonly known as the red elderberry, is a deciduous shrub native to North America. It is characterized by its clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant produces dark red berries in late summer, which are edible but have a tart flavor. Aronia arborea typically grows to a height of 2–6 meters and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have serrated edges, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
